Calling Women Entrepreneurs in MedTech & CleanTech!
IKP EDEN is excited to announce an Ask Us Anything (AUA) session for BioXcelerate ‚Äì a flagship program under the WEscalate Initiative powered by K-tech Biotechnology Facilitation Cell Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society IT BT Department, Karnataka.

BioXcelerate offers a structured 6-month incubation phase followed by a 6-month acceleration phase, with a clear focus on translating high-potential science into scalable and sustainable ventures.

Date: 11th July at 6 PM
Location - IKP EDEN (Maps:¬†goo.gl/ur42sk)
Registration Link for AUA - https://lnkd.in/gvH_RGJs
Click here to apply for the program - https://lnkd.in/gDeybQHM (Last date to apply : 26th July, 2025)

This is an excellent opportunity for women entrepreneurs working in MedTech, CleanTech, and allied sectors to learn more about the program and explore how it can support your growth journey.

Join us to ask your questions, gain clarity, and take the next big step in your entrepreneurial journey.
Stay tuned for more updates!

Following World Zoonoses Day observed on July 6th, we‚Äôre spotlighting dengue ‚Äî one of the fastest-growing mosquito-borne diseases globally, with over ùüî.ùüï ùê¶ùê¢ùê•ùê•ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêúùêöùê¨ùêûùê¨ reported in 2023 alone as per World Health Organization.

From climate change to rapid urbanisation, the spread of zoonotic diseases calls for a united response rooted in science, innovation, and collaboration.

At IKP, we're not just observing zoonotic threats‚Äîwe‚Äôre supporting solutions that reaffirm our commitment to climate-smart health systems and global collaborations where surveillance, science, and startups converge.

Let's innovate to prevent.

To collaborate with us, write to: engage@ikpknowledgepark.com 

And don't forget to follow IKP for more on health, science, and impact.

Marking #WorldBioproductDay the #BioE3 way. üå± #BIRAC‚Äôs Commitment towards a #sustainable #future

In the presence of Dr Jitendra Singh, Rajesh Gokhale, Alka Sharma Dbt and Jitendra Kumar, Stakeholders, Innovators, Academic Institutions and State Representatives across the biotech ecosystem came together to pledge on strengthening India‚Äôs commitment in building a sustainable, inclusive and innovation driven Bioeconomy focused on environmental conservation, economic opportunity and employment generation aligned with the ambitious BioE3 policy.

A shared vision towards sustainable growth and #innovation.

#BIRAC #Bioeconomy #Biomanufacturing #CircularEconomy #Gujarat #JammuKashmir #Assam #WorldBioproductDay2025 #MakeinIndia #ViksitBharat2047 

Department of Biotechnology

DBT Celebrates #WorldBioproductDay ‚Äì the #BioE3 way!

DBT's #BioE3 policy lays foundation towards a bio based circular economy. Bioproducts are about sustainable livelihoods and over the next few days, we will be highlighting research, innovations and products supported by DBT. 
 
In this, we have #astaxanthine from ICGEB, NewDelhi‚Äôs Metabolic Engineering Group. 

The team has isolated Dysmorphococcus globosus-HI, a Himalayan microalgal strain that accumulates 15‚Äì20% natural astaxanthin in just 15 days (vs. 35+ days), doubling industry yields and offering a safe, eco-friendly antioxidant source. Fast-growing, easy to harvest, and poised to elevate nutraceuticals, cosmetics, and aqua-feeds under the BioE3 policy.

#WorldBioproductDay #BioE3 #Astaxanthin #SustainableBiotech

Dr Jitendra Singh
Rajesh Gokhale
BRIC DBT
ICGEB

On #WorldBioproductDay 2025, the ‚ÄòOne Nation, One Day, One Hour per City‚Äô dialogue series brought together powerful voices to shape the future of India‚Äôs bioeconomy.

BIRAC led a compelling session on Industry‚ÄìAcademia partnerships ‚Äî a cornerstone of India's thriving biotech landscape. With the esteemed presence of Hon‚Äôble Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh, DBT Secretary Dr. Rajesh Gokhale, BIRAC MD Dr. Jitendra Kumar and Dr. Alka Sharma the dialogue emphasized innovation, collaboration, and the collective drive toward sustainable growth.

The session concluded with Dr Jitendra Singh reaffirming India's ambition to become the torchbearer of a Green Revolution Ecosystem ‚Äî one powered by biomanufacturing, circular economy principles, and the transformative vision of the BioE3 policy.

This year, the spotlight was on some of India‚Äôs most promising biotech startups, nurtured by BIRAC and supported through BioNEST incubators.

üî¨ ImmunoACT ‚Äì Dr. Shirish Arya
Developed India‚Äôs first homegrown CAR-T cell therapy, revolutionizing cancer treatment.

üç¨ Revelations Biotech Pvt. Ltd. ‚Äì Dr. Beeram Ravi Chandra 
Introduced the world‚Äôs first low-cost, indigenous sugar substitutes.

üß™ KCAT ENZYMATIC PRIVATE LIMITED  ‚Äì Dr. Pravin kumar
Crafting enzyme technologies to address industrial, medical, and environmental issues.

ü©π Fibroheal Woundcare Pvt Ltd ‚Äì Dr. Vivek Mishra
Invented FIBROPLUG, a patented wound-care solution that ensures rapid clotting and protection.

üß´ OmniBRx Biotechnologies Pvt Ltd - Ravindra Patel 
Pioneering cost-efficient bioreactor platforms for vaccines and biologics.

üå± Cell Biology & Hydroponics ‚Äì Dr. Vishal Warke
Driving advanced R&D in affordable serum-free, chemically defined media and feed supplements for therapeutic proteins.

üåæ Balrampur Chini Mills Limited ‚Äì Ms. Avantika Saraogi 
Spearheading India‚Äôs first PLA bioplastics plant ‚Äî a leap toward green, renewable, and circular biomanufacturing.

üì¢ The event also featured dynamic Student Innovator Pitches:

Sudhanshu Kumar, Chinmoy Dan, Ishika Roy ‚Äî BioBulb: A microalgae-powered device that purifies air by removing CO‚ÇÇ and airborne toxins.

Vaishnavi Sharma ‚Äî A sustainable solution using biochar from fruit peels to remove heavy metals from wastewater.

Together, these voices, innovations, and commitments are powering India's bio-revolution ‚Äî the BioE3 Way.

Jitendra Kumar I Chhaya Chauhan I Dr. Sujit Das I Kanupriya Vashishth

#IITMandiCatalyst ¬†#IITMandi #Incubator #Startups #Innovation #StartupInHills #StartupIndia #InnovationEcosystem #Entrepreneurship

IIT Mandi Catalyst recently organized a focused workshop titled Investment Outreach‚Äô for its incubated startups, led by Vikrant Potnis, Founder of Fundenable, for a deep-dive session into the realities of fundraising and startup scale-up in India. With a rich background in investment banking and venture capital, Vikrant shared powerful insights on:

üí° The three pillars of fundraising:
 ‚úîÔ∏è Fundability
 ‚úîÔ∏è Technical process
 ‚úîÔ∏è Investor access

üîç He also presented case studies from successful Fundenable portfolio startups like EMotorad, WorkIndia, and SuperBottoms, illustrating how strategic funding and strong execution drive exponential growth.

‚ú® A big thank you to Vikrant for empowering our startup founders with clarity, structure, and investor-ready wisdom!

Dipankar Deb | Satvasheel Powar | Anil Singh | Gaurav P. | Harish Kanaujia | Salik Sarwar | Manish Singh | Ravinder Kumar | vishal sharma | Minni Kaur | Kushal Deep Jagota | Lipsa Rani Panda

#IITMandiCatalyst ¬†#IITMandi #catalyst #Incubator #incubatees #startups #innovation #StartupInHills #Fundenable #StartupIndia #Fundraising #VentureCapital

üëè Startup Spotlight | SmartEye ‚Äì Empowering the Visually Impaired
We‚Äôre proud to share that Smart Eye SmartEye, a portfolio startup of IIT Mandi Catalyst, is making remarkable strides with its innovation, PathPal ‚Äì a smart blind stick designed to enhance mobility for the visually impaired.

Recently, the PathPal prototype underwent extensive user testing across multiple blind schools, where users explored the device in real-world settings. The team received valuable feedback and built trust within the community‚Äîensuring the product truly meets user needs.

üîç About SmartEye:
 SmartEye operates in the assistive technology space within the healthtech sector, developing intelligent solutions using ultrasonic sensors and AI/ML algorithms to solve navigation challenges for the visually impaired.

We‚Äôre excited to see how SmartEye continues to make a real-world impact! üåçüí°

As a startup supported by DERBI Foundation, it's inspiring to witness global initiatives like this that are investing in purpose-driven ventures with transformative potential. 

At DERBI Foundation, we‚Äôve experienced firsthand how the right ecosystem support‚Äîaccess to prototyping, mentorship, and patient capital‚Äîcan shape the journey of early-stage innovators.

Opportunities like these validate the importance of cross-border collaboration in building technologies that don't just push the envelope but also address real-world challenges in health, sustainability, and quality of life.

üéì Academia Meets Innovation at DERBI Foundation! üß†üöÄ

We were delighted to welcome faculty members from the Dayananda Sagar Business Academy as part of a Faculty Development Program (FDP) aimed at bridging the gap between academic knowledge and entrepreneurial application.

The session included an engaging walkthrough of DERBI Foundation‚Äôs lab and Dayananda Sagar University's innovation campus at Kudlu Gate, where faculty had the opportunity to experience the startup ecosystem up close, from ideation spaces to prototyping labs, and incubation support facilities.

The visit sparked meaningful conversations around how real-world problem-solving, startup exposure, and innovation-driven thinking can be brought into the classroom to better prepare students for tomorrow‚Äôs challenges.

We look forward to more such academia-industry interactions that nurture a stronger entrepreneurial culture on campuses! üå±üí°

Work In Progress ‚Äì July 2025 edition is here! 

This month, we spotlight innovation that shows up in many forms‚Äîquiet pilots, policy dialogues, and global collaborations. 

From linking biogas systems to global carbon markets to grassroots workshops on soil resilience, to deep-tech solutions making their mark across Southeast Asia, Europe, and the Middle East‚Äîthis edition captures the steady convergence of ideas, communities, and systems. 

You‚Äôll find start-ups shaping climate-resilient agriculture, ocean sustainability, dignified health access, and decentralised energy. You'll also see how IP milestones, field demos, and cross-sector partnerships are laying the foundation for future scale. 

Explore these stories of layered progress‚Äîand the people making it possible. 

Subscribe to receive future editions: https://lnkd.in/gw6bPWVh
¬† ¬†
Explore past editions: https://lnkd.in/gh4aF9cq¬† 

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Smita Rakesh | Dr Kavita Singh | Neeraj Jain | Harish Hande 

#WorkInProgress #InvestedInImpact #InnovationForImpact

Innovators working on developing medical devices for screening and diagnosis often struggle with accessing funds for clinical trials and regulatory pathways. At this stage equity funding is almost non-existent.  (Sometimes it may be there but comes with extremely bad terms combined wifh hyper-dilution and horrific captables). 

This is where blended finance needs to be redefined. Capital providers need to understand that  de-risking early stage startups requires a continuum of capital where non dilutive and dilutive capital pools operate synchronously throughtout the product lifecycle depending upon the stage, complexity and market readiness of the innovations. This is not like a relay race where capital providers change roles but more like an orchestra where different pools can synchronise their risk underwriting and maximise the impact while creating value as the innovations transition from the lab to market.

#blendedfinance #valleyofdeath #impact #innovation  Social Alpha

In agriculture, productivity is only part of the story. 

Without efficient post-harvest systems, much of what‚Äôs grown is lost, or sold at distress prices. 

Farmers need access to infrastructure that preserves produce quality, extends shelf-life life, and enables value addition. For perishable crops, in particular, the time between harvest and sale is critical. 

We‚Äôre inviting start-ups developing solutions for: 

- Affordable, accessible preservation and processing¬†
- Modular storage with hybrid or passive cooling¬†
- Off-grid or decentralised post-harvest infrastructure¬†
- Quality monitoring, grading, and traceability 

Solutions should be relevant to smallholder farmers, and adaptable to a range of crops and geographies.¬†
¬†
Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and design support, incubation, mentorship, and access to scale-up networks.
¬†
Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony
¬†
#FarmingForward #PostHarvestInnovation #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

I‚Äôm deeply honoured to be featured in¬†‚ÄúSHE IS: Women in Chemistry‚Äù, a celebration of 75 Indian women researchers who are shaping the future of science and innovation through their work.

This beautifully curated initiative‚Äîled by the Red Dot Foundation in collaboration with the¬†Royal Society of Chemistry (UK)¬†and the¬†Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India‚Äîis a powerful reminder of the collective strength and brilliance of women in science. I‚Äôm sincerely grateful to the organisers for this recognition and for spotlighting stories that often go untold.

To be featured alongside such phenomenal scientists and innovators is not just a personal milestone‚Äîit is a moment of deep pride for our scientific community, and especially for every woman forging her path in STEM.
To every young girl with a dream:¬†Dream Big! your curiosity matters, your voice matters, your science matters! The world needs you‚Äînow more than ever.

Here's to more voices being heard, more stories being told, and more barriers being broken!‚ú®¬†¬†

Over the past two weeks, VentureStudio hosted two engaging events that brought together students, makers, and founders from across the ecosystem.

We began with a hands-on 3D Printing Workshop at DST Prayas Shala, where participants explored the fundamentals of additive manufacturing, from basic design principles to operating a 3D printer. Attendees created their own prototypes and gained practical exposure to tools that enable rapid innovation. 

This was followed by a powerful panel discussion on "Building Startup Teams and Company Culture," featuring founders who‚Äôve built successful ventures across sectors. Dr. Purav Gandhi (Healthark), Aenik Shah (Wizzy.ai), Abhishek Acharya (Theka Coffee), Shalin (Shawn) Parikh (MYCPE ONE), Shrijay Sheth (LegalWiz.in) and Jatin Chaudhary (eChai Ventures) shared hard-earned insights on hiring, values, and leadership. The room was filled with students, early-stage entrepreneurs, and professionals eager to learn what it really takes to build cohesive, high-performing teams.

Thank you to all the speakers and participants for making these sessions impactful. Stay tuned for more events from VentureStudio.

#Innovation #Entrepreneurship #3DPrinting #StartupCulture #AhmedabadUniversity #StartupIndia #DesignToPrototype #Founders #TeamBuilding

At DST Prayas Shala: Where Ideas Take Shape, we provide innovators and early-stage startups with advanced prototyping infrastructure and specialized technical support.

Our makerspace at Ahmedabad University bridges the gap between concept and market-ready products through sophisticated design and fabrication capabilities. We enable rapid prototyping cycles that help entrepreneurs validate ideas and accelerate time-to-market.

Ready to transform your hardware innovation into reality? Connect with our team to explore how DST Prayas Shala can support your venture.

#Innovation #StartupSupport #PrototypingLab #HardwareDevelopment #AhmedabadUniversity

Inside Bio-NEST, where Innovation meets infrastructure. Ever wondered how biotech ideas turn into real-world solutions? At Bio-NEST, Ahmedabad University, startups get access to high-end tools, expert support, and a vibrant community.

Peek into one of our core instruments, a lyophilized, used to extend product shelf life in biopharma, food, and cosmetics without damaging properties.

Whether you're building in health, agri, or industrial biotech, Bio-NEST offers:
‚úÖ Cutting-edge lab equipment
‚úÖ Custom support for early-stage ventures
‚úÖ A thriving network of innovators

As part of the ProtoQuik Launchpad, iCreate hosted a virtual session with senior officials from the Gujarat Pollution Control Board (GPCB), exploring real-world deployment opportunities for Robotics solutions in environmental management.

The discussion focused on real-world use cases ‚Äî from cleaning lakes and beaches to accessing hazardous sites, inspecting pipelines, and navigating confined spaces where human intervention is difficult. GPCB officials shared their perspective on how such technologies can enhance operational efficiency and safety in environmental monitoring and waste management.

Our Robotics startups presented their prototypes, initiating a meaningful dialogue on potential field trials with GPCB‚Äôs support.

We thank Shri. D. M. Thaker, Member Secretary, GPCB and Sr. Officials from GPCB, Shri. Agrawat, Shri Niraj Shah, Shri T.C. Patel, and Shri Ashvin Mistry for their time, insights, and encouragement.

#ProtoQuikLaunchpad #Robotics #CleanTech #Sustainability #DeepTechForImpact #iCreateWithYou #GPCB #StartupCollaboration #FieldTrials #InnovationForEnvironment

ProtoQuik Launchpad is designed to bridge that gap helping founders transform R&D into measurable ROI with the right mentorship, resources, and momentum to turn prototypes into products.

üß† From Vision to Validation - an eye-opening session by Yoav Fekete, Founder of NaadLabs, for ProtoQuik Launchpad - Cohort 1 (Robotics).

Startups were pushed to rethink how they build:
‚úî Love the problem, not the product
‚úî Test fast, fail smart
‚úî Build for real-world impact

With invaluable insights on product-market fit, MVPs in robotics, and why most startups fail, this session marked a powerful mindset shift for our cohort - from just building tech to solving meaningful problems.
